page.title: 13EDUCATION
page.content: At Kingsland School today we have 92 children. Kingsland School is a primary school. The ages in a primary school are between 4 and 11. The children are split into 4 classes. When you leave primary school you go to high school. The high schools in this area are Wigmore,Weobley and Leominster. The ages are between 11 and 16. Sometimes people stay until they are 18. After high school some people go to colleges or universites. In Kingsland school in 1966 there were 73 children. In 1975 there were 88 and in 1985 there are 92. When Eardisland School closed in 1979 there were 15 pupils and the children and teachers were transfered to Kingsland. Now 27 Eardisland children attend Kingsland school. Without them the number on roll at Kingsland would have been only 65.
